main event: On September 19, 1958 at Montgomery Field in San Diego, a civilian reported sighting two circular silvery metallic discs, each the size of a basketball, shifting from side to side.
interesting points: The observation lasted 10-20 seconds, indicating a brief but clear sighting of the objects.
The observer was an experienced aircraft recognition personnel with two years of training at the Naval Training Center in San Diego.
There were no discernible features on the discs, but they were described as hovering and slowly rising, then moving to the east and north-east.
The report was part of Project Blue Book, the U.S. Air Force's official program to investigate UFOs.
The evaluation of the sighting suggested that the objects could have been balloons, indicating an attempt to find a prosaic explanation.
sighted object: two circular silvery metallic discs, each the size of a basketball
